brief_summary.textblock:
It has been demonstrated that EPA and DHA supplementation may have anti-inflammatory
      properties in several chronic diseases, namely, diabetes, obesity, and in rheumatoid
      arthritis, although not with controversy. Systemic lupus erythematosus is an autoimmune
      disease characterized by a chronic inflammatory state which is associated with the disease´s
      clinical symptoms. Thus, we hypothesized that EPA and DHA supplementation may beneficially
      affect the inflammatory cytokine profile and clinical features of LES patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of EPA and DHA Supplementation in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age between 7 and 40 years

          -  SLEDAI ≤ 4

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Cardiovascular dysfunction

          -  Rhythm and conduction disorders

          -  Musculoskeletal disturbances

          -  Kidney and pulmonary involvements

          -  Peripheral neuropathy

          -  Use of tobacco

          -  Treatment with lipid-lowering or hypoglycemic drugs

          -  Fibromyalgia

          -  Use of chronotropic or antihypertensive drugs

          -  Physically active subjects

intervention.description: Subjects will be given 3g/d (1,2g of DHA and 1,8g of EPA) - 5 capsules per day.
Subjects will be given 3g/d of soy oil - 5 capsules per day.

facility.name: General Hospital - University of Sao Paulo

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.description: Cytokines´ serum levels (pg/ml) will be assessed by Elisa kits.
primary_outcome.measure: Cytokine profile (serum levels of IL-1B, IL-2, IL-4, IL-6, IL-8, IL-10, TNF-alpha, IFN-y)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Disease activity - assessed by SLEDAI score
Quality of life - assessed by SF-36 questionaire
Fatigue - assessed by 2 questionaires - Chalders´Fatigue Scale and Fatigue Severity Scale (FSS)
Body composition - lean (Kg) and fat mass (Kg) assessed by air displacement pletysmography (BOD POD).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
